properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 4:50AM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected today.
Total snow accumulations of one to two inches mainly during the
morning hours. Snow should mix with rain during the afternoon.
Light snow will be possible again this evening. Wind gusts of 35
to 40 mph will also be possible late this evening. For the Wind
Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected tonight. Wind
chills as low as 15 below zero.

* WHERE...Jefferson County.

* WHEN...The Winter Weather Advisory is in effect until midnight
CST tonight. The Wind Chill Advisory is in effect from
midnight tonight to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions
are not taken.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
